oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Green Street Church of Christ, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Green Street Church of Christ located at 146 Green Street in Nashville, Tennessee. The congregation was founded in 1892, and the present church building was completed in 1930 after the original frame structure burned in 1929. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are predominately red brick, with tan brick corners and window frames. The windows are dark, tinted plexi-glass. Clear glass panes make up the basement windows. The doors are wood. The five-sided front entry with two doors and one window has a tar shingle awning. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Green Street Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.)
